PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Mr. A.M. King, 236 Meadow Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 4, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you believe that Negro communities actually choose their leaders or do they accept the leadership, which 'the powers-that-be' select and 'hand' to them?" answer reads: "I think that the Negro community accepts the leadership that the powers-that-be hand down in politics. When it comes to the selection of civic leaders, the Negro community selects its leaders."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of A.M. King wearing dark three piece suit and dark fedora with "Identification check" card stuck in brim, standing on Fifth Avenue, with Warner Theater in background, Downtown
